Key Arguments: The submission questions who gets to decide what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
It expresses distrust in authorities, citing examples of alleged corruption and misinformation during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The submission argues that truth has been suppressed by authorities and mainstream media.
It emphasizes the importance of questioning, investigating, and using common sense to discern truth.
The submission criticizes the concentration of media ownership and its impact on information credibility.
Main Themes: Distrust in authority and mainstream media
Concerns about censorship and freedom of speech
Emphasis on individual investigation and critical thinking
Notable Quotes: "People in control are not always correct. People in control can (and do) LIE."
"The point is that truth has been suppressed by people and institutions of 'authority'."
